00030 template <typename Value, class Container = QVector<Value> >
00031 class TMultiProperty: public CPropertyBase
00032 {

00034        typedef Value ValueType;
00035        typedef CPropertyBase BaseClass;

00126 template <typename Value, class Container>
00127 TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::TMultiProperty()

00132 template <typename Value, class Container>
00133 TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::TMultiProperty(
00134                             IPropertiesManager* propertyOwnerPtr,
00135                             const QByteArray& propertyId,
00136                             const QByteArray& propertyDescription,
00137                             int propertyFlags,
00138                             int changeFlags,
00139                             int elementsCount,
00140                             Value* valuesPtr)
00141        :BaseClass(propertyOwnerPtr, propertyId, propertyDescription, propertyFlags, changeFlags)
00142 {
00143        for (int i = 0; i < elementsCount; ++i){
00144               m_values.push_back(valuesPtr[i]);
00145        }
00146 }

00149 template <typename Value, class Container>
00150 void TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::SetValues(const ValueList& valueList)
00151 {
00152        SetValues<ValueList>(valueList.begin(), valueList.end());
00153 }
00154 
00155 
00156 template <typename Value, class Container>
00157 template <class ContainerImpl>
00158 void TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::SetValues(typename ContainerImpl::const_iterator beginIter, typename ContainerImpl::const_iterator endIter)
00159 {
00160        istd::CChangeNotifier changePtr(m_propertyOwnerPtr, m_changeFlags);
00161 
00162        ResetValues();
00163 
00164        while (beginIter != endIter){
00165               InsertValue(*beginIter);
00166 
00167               ++beginIter;
00168        }
00169 }

00179 template <typename Value, class Container>
00180 int TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::GetValuesCount() const
00181 {
00182        return int(m_values.size());
00183 }

00186 template <typename Value, class Container>
00187 Value TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::GetValueAt(int index) const
00188 {
00189        I_ASSERT(index >= 0);
00190        I_ASSERT(index < GetValuesCount());
00191 
00192        return m_values[index];
00193 }
00194 
00195 
00196 template <typename Value, class Container>
00197 void TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::SetValueAt(int index, const Value& value)
00198 {
00199        I_ASSERT(index >= 0);
00200        I_ASSERT(index < GetValuesCount());
00201 
00202        if (m_values[index] != value){
00203               istd::CChangeNotifier changePtr(m_propertyOwnerPtr, m_changeFlags);
00204 
00205               m_values[index] = value;
00206        }
00207 }
00208 
00209 
00210 template <typename Value, class Container>
00211 void TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::InsertValue(const Value& value)
00212 {
00213        m_values.push_back(value);
00214 }
00215 
00216 
00217 template <typename Value, class Container>
00218 void TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::ResetValues()
00219 {
00220        istd::CChangeNotifier changePtr(m_propertyOwnerPtr, m_changeFlags);
00221        
00222        m_values.clear();
00223 }

00265 // reimplemented (iser::ISerializable)
00266 
00267 template <typename Value, class Container>
00268 bool TMultiProperty<Value, Container>::Serialize(iser::IArchive& archive)
00269 {
00270        static iser::CArchiveTag valuesTag("Values", "List of property values");
00271        static iser::CArchiveTag valueTag("Value", "Single Value");
00272 
00273        bool isStoring = archive.IsStoring();
00274 
00275        istd::CChangeNotifier notifier(isStoring? NULL: this);
00276 
00277        bool retVal = true;
00278 
00279        if (isStoring){
00280               int valuesCount = int(m_values.size());
00281 
00282               retVal = retVal && archive.BeginMultiTag(valuesTag, valueTag, valuesCount);
00283               for (ValueList::iterator iter = m_values.begin(); iter != m_values.end(); ++iter){
00284                      retVal = retVal && archive.BeginTag(valueTag);
00285                      retVal = retVal && archive.Process(*iter);
00286                      retVal = retVal && archive.EndTag(valueTag);
00287               }
00288               retVal = retVal && archive.EndTag(valuesTag);
00289        }
00290        else{
00291               int valuesCount = 0;
00292 
00293               retVal = retVal && archive.BeginMultiTag(valuesTag, valueTag, valuesCount);
00294               if (!retVal){
00295                      return false;
00296               }
00297 
00298               // load properties 'in place', without allocation of new elements
00299               int itemIndex = 0;
00300               for (ValueList::iterator iter = m_values.begin(); iter != m_values.end(); ++iter){
00301                      // remove rest of elements, if current number of elements is bigger than the stored
00302                      if (itemIndex >= valuesCount){
00303                             m_values.erase(iter, m_values.end());
00304 
00305                             break;
00306                      }
00307 
00308                      retVal = retVal && archive.BeginTag(valueTag);
00309                      retVal = retVal && archive.Process(*iter);
00310                      retVal = retVal && archive.EndTag(valueTag);
00311 
00312                      ++itemIndex;
00313               }
00314 
00315               // load rest of properties if current number of elements is smaller than the stored
00316               while (itemIndex < valuesCount){
00317                      retVal = retVal && archive.BeginTag(valueTag);
00318                      Value value;
00319                      retVal = retVal && archive.Process(value);
00320                      m_values.push_back(value);
00321                      retVal = retVal && archive.EndTag(valueTag);
00322 
00323                      ++itemIndex;
00324               }
00325 
00326               retVal = retVal && archive.EndTag(valuesTag);
00327        }
00328 
00329        return retVal;
00330 }
